p: Annual average APIs were positively and significantly correlated with total mortality rate in 2012 ( r = 0.21, R 2 = 4.4%, p = 0.030), and in 2013 ( r = 0.26, R 2 = 6.7%, p = 0.013) (Figures 4A,B). After adjustment for socioeconomic status (SES, assessed by GDP per capital), the association between API and total mortality remained statistically significant in 2012 ( r = 0.21, p = 0.031) and in 2013 ( r = 0.22, p = 0.039). An adjustment for the inclusion of both SES and the percent of residents aged 60 and older shows that the correlation coefficients of API with total mortality remained positive, although they became borderline significant in 2012 ( r = 0.18, p = 0.062) and in 2013 ( r = 0.21, p = 0.053).
